page_analysis.text_content:
Fig 4 Types of porches and entry ways

A Roofed porch

C Vaulted entry way
Height
greater than 12'
above grade

See how to measure height of porches &
entry features in Figs 6-8 on pp. 11-13

B Roofed entry way
(not vaulted)
Height
less than 12'
above grade

D Combination porch & vaulted entry way
Height
greater than 12'
above grade

visual_elements.description: Four architectural elevation drawings showing different types of porches and entry ways. Drawing A shows a single-story building with a roofed porch supported by columns. Drawing B shows a two-story house with a small roofed entry way with height measurement indicator showing 'less than 12' above grade'. Drawing C shows a two-story building with a vaulted entry way and height measurement indicator showing 'greater than 12' above grade'. Drawing D shows a building combining both a porch and vaulted entry way with height measurement indicator showing 'greater than 12' above grade'.
visual_elements.location: Center of page, arranged in 2x2 grid format

visual_elements.description: Height measurement indicators with vertical lines and dimension markings showing measurement points from grade level to top of architectural features
visual_elements.location: Right side of drawings B, C, and D

visual_elements.description: Gray rectangular text box containing reference information about measuring height
visual_elements.location: Center of page between drawings B and D

technical_specifications.parameter: Height threshold for vaulted entry way
Height threshold for roofed entry way (not vaulted)

structural_elements.main_heading: Fig 4 Types of porches and entry ways
subheadings: D Combination porch & vaulted entry way

additional_notes: Image quality is clear with good contrast
Architectural drawings are technical line drawings showing building elevations
Height measurement indicators use standard architectural notation

logical_relationships.expression: If height is less than 12' above grade and not vaulted, then it is classified as a roofed entry way
If height is greater than 12' above grade, then it is classified as a vaulted entry way
If height is greater than 12' above grade and combines porch and vaulted features, then it is classified as a combination porch & vaulted entry way

execution_sequence.action: Measure height of porch or entry feature from grade level
Determine if feature is vaulted or not vaulted
Classify the porch or entry way type based on height and vaulting characteristics
